final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 significant figures (limited by 0.150 mol dm-3 NaOH).

method: Convert the NaOH titre volume to dm3: 23.40 cm3 = 0.02340 dm3. Use c = n/V rearranged to n = cV to find moles of NaOH: n(NaOH) = 0.150 × 0.02340 = 0.00351 mol. From H2SO4 + 2NaOH → Na2SO4 + 2H2O, 2 mol NaOH react with 1 mol H2SO4, so n(H2SO4) = 0.00351/2 = 0.001755 mol. Convert the acid volume to dm3: 25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3, then c(H2SO4) = n/V = 0.001755/0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Because 2 mol NaOH are needed per 1 mol acid, the acid concentration should be roughly half the NaOH concentration adjusted for volume; 0.0702 mol dm-3 fits.
Units check: (mol dm-3) × (dm3) gives mol for moles, then mol/dm3 returns mol dm-3.
